title: Women's 3000 m - Speed Skating Squaw Valley 1960 Winter Olympics
table: {"0":{"0":null,"1":"Women's 3000 m 1960","2":null,"3":"Final","4":null,"5":null,"6":null,"7":null,"8":"4.","9":"5.","10":"6.","11":"7.","12":"8.","13":"9.","14":"10.","15":"11.","16":"12.","17":"13.","18":"14.","19":"15.","20":"16.","21":"17.","22":"18.","23":"19.","24":"20.","25":null,"26":null,"27":"Women's 3000 m - Speed Skating - Squaw Valley 1960 Winter Olympics Event Format:  Skaters raced against the clock although they raced in pairs on separate lanes on an oval rink (inner and outer lanes). Skaters had to change lanes in the back straightaway of each lap in order to skate an equal distance. The skater on the outer lane had the right of way and the skater leaving the inner lane should avoid collision. The Olympic gold medal winner was the athlete with the fastest time for the race. Event facts: Women's 3000 m competition was held at the Blyth Memorial Arena and 20 athletes participated in the event.","28":null,"29":"These results for Women's 3000 m - Squaw Valley 1960 Winter Olympics - are based on the official olympic reports and the Olympian Database","30":null},"1":{"0":null,"1":"Women's 3000 m 1960","2":null,"3":"Final","4":null,"5":"Lydia Skoblikova","6":"Valentina Stenina","7":"Eevi Huttunen","8":"Hatsue Takamizawa","9":"Christina Scherling","10":"Helena Pilejczyk","11":"Elwira Seroczynska","12":"Jeanne Ashworth","13":"Tamara Rylova","14":"Yoshiko Takano","15":"Elsa Einarsson","16":"Iris Sihvonen","17":"Inge Gormer","18":"Doreen Ryan","19":"Francoise Lucas","20":"Margaret Robb","21":"Gisela T\u00f6ws","22":"Cornelia Harrington","23":"Beverly Buhr","24":"Kim Kyung-hoy","25":null,"26":null,"27":"Women's 3000 m - Speed Skating - Squaw Valley 1960 Winter Olympics Event Format:  Skaters raced against the clock although they raced in pairs on separate lanes on an oval rink (inner and outer lanes).
